LayoutNode.Content: Department of Computer Science, University of Oxford Oxford Centre for Integrative Systems Biology
LayoutNode.SRC: Department of Computer Science, University of Oxford Oxford Centre for Integrative Systems Biology

LayoutNode.Content: I share my time, half and half, between Oxford and the Mathematics Department at the Queensland University of Technology (QUT http://www.qut.edu.au), Brisbane, Australia, where I am Professor of Computational Mathematics. I am also a theme leader in the new Institute for Future Environments at QUT http://www.qut.edu.au/institute-for-future-environments.
LayoutNode.SRC: I share my time, half and half, between Oxford and the Mathematics Department at the  Queensland University of Technology (QUT  http://www.qut.edu.au), Brisbane, Australia, where I am Professor of Computational Mathematics.  I am also a theme leader in the new Institute for Future Environments at QUT http://www.qut.edu.au/institute-for-future-environments.

LayoutNode.Content: I was a supernumerary fellow of New College at Oxford University between 2008-2012. Before coming to Oxford I was a Federation Fellow of the Australian Research Council (2003-2008) at the University of Queensland.
LayoutNode.SRC: I was a supernumerary fellow of New College at Oxford University between 2008-2012.  Before coming to Oxford I  was a Federation Fellow of the Australian Research Council (2003-2008) at the University of Queensland.

LayoutNode.Content: I am married to Pamela, who is also in the Mathematics Department at QUT, and we have two children at Queensland. Matt has finished his medical program and is a registrar, Lauren is her final year of her Medical program.
LayoutNode.SRC: I am married to Pamela, who is also in the Mathematics Department at QUT, and we have two children at Queensland.  Matt has finished his medical program and is a registrar, Lauren is her final year of her Medical program.

LayoutNode.Content: Stochastic modelling for the Life Sciences
My main collaborators at Oxford are
Blanca Rodriguez - the Cardiac modelling and simulation group in CS

LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Louie Cardone-Noott (joint supervision with Blanca Rodriguez, Alfonso Bueno-Orovio)

LayoutNode.Content: My current main research project is to understand how structure and dynamics, whether it be at the cell level or at tissue level, inform function. The main focus here is in the electrophysiology of the heart. At the cell level we have developed new stochastic techniques for simuating ion channel dynamics. While at the tissue level we are developing a new theory based on fractional diffusion to offer insights into the dyamics of cardiac electrophysiology in the setting of heterogeneous tissue. We have a paper submitted to Nature Communications and we are currently validating our model against Diffusion Tensor MRI data.
LayoutNode.SRC: My current main research project is to understand how structure and dynamics, whether it be at the cell level or at tissue level, inform function. The main focus here is in the electrophysiology of the heart. At the cell level we have developed new stochastic techniques for simuating ion channel dynamics. While at the tissue level we are developing a new theory based on fractional diffusion to offer insights into the dyamics of cardiac electrophysiology in the setting of heterogeneous tissue. We have a paper submitted to Nature Communications and we are currently validating our model against Diffusion Tensor MRI data.
